snippet: Dr. Fitch shared the 1980 Nobel Prize in Physics for work that helped explain why the collision of matter and antimatter has not destroyed everything in the cosmos.
abstract: Val Fitch, who shared 1980 Nobel Prize in Physics for work revealing surprising imbalance in the laws of nature and helped explain why the collision of matter and antimatter had not destroyed everything in the universe, dies at age 91.
lead_paragraph: Dr. Fitch shared the 1980 Nobel Prize in Physics for work that helped explain why the collision of matter and antimatter has not destroyed everything in the cosmos.

headline.main: Val Fitch, Who Discovered Universe to Be Out of Balance, Is Dead at 91
headline.print_headline: Val Fitch, Who Helped Discover Flaw in Symmetry of Universe, Dies at 91
